intro: Bourreria radula, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrgram, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its root system is adapted to withstand drought conditions, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry climates. The plant is often found in rocky soils and is considered a characteristic species of desert ecosystems.
